result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaquell L Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid by 2-17-2015 or shall convert to a civil judgment.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.  *3/15/2016  Honorable Frederick C. Rosa-credit amended to 39 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Follow all other conditions as determined by DOC.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

records.addlTxt:
- signed and filed. 
THE COURT ORDERS: The petition for sentence adjustment is DENIED because it is not in the public interest.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. spc

Defendant Jaquell L Jones in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jaquell L Jones in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  Additional statements by Lauren J.  The Court imposes the following Bifurcated Sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 30 MONTHS concurrent with any other sentence.
Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 18 MONTHS months with credit for  30 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 12 MONTHS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R1.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid by 2-17-2015 or shall convert to a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
- The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- No contact with drug users.
- Follow all other conditions as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement and Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Jaquell L Jones in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Step Nolten for Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jaquell L Jones in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Jaquell L Jones in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
